title: Joachim Trier on the Success (and Critics) of ‘Sentimental Value,’ Fighting for Theatrical and Mentoring Ryan Coogler
summary: The filmmaker, who earned an Oscar nomination in 2022 for 'Worst Person in the World,' tells The Hollywood Reporter: “I’m trying to tell young people that are nervous about the theatrical experience for their movies: Keep fighting for it, because it’s possible.”

title: New Year Starts With Fewer U.S. Oil and Gas Rigs
summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States fell by 4 this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published earlier this week, bringing the total rig count in the US to 544 this week, down 40 from this same time last year. The number of active oil rigs fell …

title: Larian's given us a single-word spoiler for Divinity, its next game, and for some reason it's 'alligator'
body: Unsurprisingly, Larian Studios isn't revealing much about Divinity 's story, characters, and world, not least because it's likely to change a lot from now until its eventual launch. Baldur's Gate 3 made significant changes to characters and story arcs from its early access launch, so it's a fool's errand to even attempt to pin anything down at this point. But when's that ever stopped anyone? In the Divinity AMA with the studio, Redditor 'ilikebreadabunch' found the only opening and took it, asking Larian if there's a small spoiler that it could give that won't make any sense until we've actually played the game. Larian obliged, and writing director Adam Smith simply replied , "Alligator". Well…uh, that certainly fits the bill. Even if it's a main story spoiler, perhaps a character's final words (that would be an odd choice, I'll admit), good luck getting anything of use from it. With no confirmed release date or even window right now, we'll be waiting a long time before we find out what this clue's all about. I'm grasping at straws here, but perhaps there'll be a fight against alligators, similar to the infamous killer crocs in Divinity: Original Sin 2's opening area of Fort Joy. …

title: Why a Historic Intervention in Venezuela Barely Moved Crude
summary: The week ending January 9, 2026, was anything but ordinary for crude oil markets. title: Venezuela’s Oil in Floating Storage Soars to 29 Million Barrels
summary: The volume of Venezuelan oil in tankers at sea has jumped to over 29 million barrels following the U.S. blitz to extract Nicolas Maduro out of Venezuela, up from 20 million barrels held at sea at the start of this week, Bloomberg reported on Friday, quoting vessel-monitoring data by Kpler. title: Venezuela Fuel Oil Flows to U.S. Pushes Asian Premium to 8-Month High
summary: The prospect of increased Venezuelan heavy crude and fuel oil flows to the U.S. Gulf Coast has upended the high-sulfur fuel oil (HSFO) market as far as Asia.
